item.title: NSF GRFP Virtual Bootcamp begins April 7th
item.description: Date: Monday, April 7, 2025 (all day) - Complete online modules at your own pace. Develop strong application materials for this 3 year fellowship which provides salary and tuition for graduate school. Fall 2025 seniors, 1st and 2nd year grad students in STEM fields that do not already hold a graduate degree are eligible. U.S. citizenship or permanent residency required. For info:madige@rpi.edu Feedback on application materials available for all applicants. Register: https://surveys.rpi.edu/jfe/form/SV_85M3eKII9idFy5M

item.title: Cog Sci Speaker Nicholas Duran Set for April 2
item.description: Join Cog Sci for a talk on April 2 at 12pm in Carnegie 113. In this talk, Nicholas will illustrate how linguistic alignment—how people “re-use” each other’s lexical, syntactic, and semantic language structures—provides a window into the mechanisms that enable shared meaning in communication.

item.title: Have you heard about RPI Bylaws?
item.description: RPI is governed by a Board of Trustees (BOT), empowered by the bylaws. Our governance structure includes the BOT, the President and Cabinet, Academic Leadership (Provost & Deans’ Council), the Faculty Senate, and Student Governance (Student Union, Student Senate, Undergraduate Council, & Graduate Council), along with Staff Engagement. Want to learn more? Dive into Standard 7 of RPI’s Self-Study for Middle States Accreditation, a team led by Dr. Andrew White & Ms. Rajni Soharu.

item.title: “Create Reproducible R Environments with renv!” RPIrates Monthly Meeting (Weds, 02 Apr, 6p, AE217)
item.description: RPI R users are invited to the April 2025 meeting of RPIrates: The RPI R Users Group! Our topic for Weds, 02 Apr (6p, AE217) will be “Create Reproducible R Environments with renv!,” led by Dr. John S. Erickson, Director of Research Operations of the Future of Computing Institute (FOCI) at Rensselaer and Chief Instigator of RPIrates. In this session we’ll learn how R’s renv package can be used to create reproducible R environments that are more isolated, portable and reproducible.

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Workshop: Leading from Anywhere | April 18 (Registration Required)
item.description:
At Rensselaer, we maintain that “leadership” involves a learnable set of actions and behaviors that is available to everyone. In this workshop, participants will explore the tenants that comprise everyday leadership and discuss the behaviors that define leadership not as positional or based on title, but rather on values and actions.When: Friday, April 18, 2025- 9:00 AM - 11:00 AMWhere: Human Resources-Gurley BuildingCost: Free: Registration is RequiredSee: https://share.percipio.com/cd/biKhfYhXa
